column2: Target-MasterCard settlement moves ahead despite U.S. judge's doubtsTarget-MasterCard settlement moves ahead despite U.S. judge's doubts NEW YORK/CHICAGO A federal judge has rejected a bid from a group of banks and credit unions suing Target Corp  over its 2013 data breach to block the company's proposed $19 million settlement with MasterCard Inc . column3: which is in the middle of a three-way takeover battle
column4: has said it is unwilling to sell itself to Israeli rival Teva Pharmaceuticals Industries Ltd
column5: but would consider buying that company down the road
column6: Mylan Executive Chairman Robert Coury told investors this week.

column2: Wal-Mart to buy some former Target stores in CanadaUPDATE 2-Wal-Mart buys some former Target Canada stores May 8 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Canadian unit said it would buy some store leases and other assets formerly held by the Canadian arm of Target Corp and renovate them for about C$350 million ($289 million).
